label: CrystalMeasurement TitleCitation
definition: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

label: AnalysisDateTime DateText
definition: Free text to allow for vague dates or description of analysis period.

label: Alteration
definition: Container for describing metasomatic, metamorphic or diagenetic changes to units

label: HostRockStratigraphy Bed
definition: The smallest division of a named stratified series normally with well defined division from adjacent deposits.

label: CrystalMeasurement Parameter
definition: Describes type of measurement or fact, such as width, abundance, circumference, temperature etc. or color etc.

label: FeedingPredationTraces
definition: Free text description relating to aspects of feeding and predation e.g. ammonite with bite mark from plesiosaur,  shell drilled by predatory gastropod etc.

label: HazardText
definition: Free text describing any hazards that may be associated with the specimen/unit e.g. is it radioactive, poisonous, carcinogenic?

label: Geologists
definition: The geologist(s) and or organisation responsible for logging the borehole and or maintaining the borehole record.

label: CrystalMeasurement Method
definition: Method used to make measurement.

label: AnalysisReferences TitleCitation
definition: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

label: Geologists Representation
definition:
Language-specific label representation.
[ATTR: language]

label: HoleDirection
definition: Direction and inclination of the borehole or well.

label: CrystalForm
definition: Container element for describing the crystal form of a mineral unit.

label: AnalysisDateTime ISODateTimeBegin
definition: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format.

label: CrystalMeasurement
definition: Individual measurement or fact related to a crystal unit - container for standard MeasurementOrFact complex type from main schema.

label: AnalysisDateTime TimeZone
definition: The time zone to which the time-of-day data refer.

label: CrystalFormText
definition: Free text description of crystal form.

label: AnalysisDateTime
definition: When the analysis was carried out.

label: CrystalMeasurement AppliesTo
definition: Depending on the use of the type, this can further specify the actual part measured. For example, a measurement of temperature may be a surface, air or sub-surface measurement.

label: AnalysisReferences
definition: Container for 1 or more references related to the analysis.

label: BaselineDatum
definition: Text - what is the baseline e.g. top of borehole or base of measured section

label: HostRockStratigraphy
definition: Container for any stratigraphic determination specific to the host rock. For instance the gathering site may include a range of stratigraphic horizons whilst the unit host rock may represent just one. The unit itself might be different if it is allochthonous in origin. Minerals may be of a different age from their host rock.

label: Geologists Abbreviation
definition: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

label: Geologists OrgUnit
definition: (vCard:OrgUnit)

label: Completeness
definition: Free text descrbing the degree of completeness of the specimen e.g. complete, cephalon only, but may describe completeness of a part e.g. complete skull.

label: DipDegrees
definition: The dip in degrees of laminae or stratal surfaces in this layer.

label: Hazard
definition: Container for describing hazards that may be associated with the specimen e.g. radioactive, toxic, carcinogens etc.

label: Geologists PreferredName
definition: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

label: Geologists Name
definition: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

label: AnalysisReferences CitationDetail
definition: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

label: CrystalMeasurement Duration
definition: Duration of measurement in time.

label: EarthScienceSpecimen
definition: Container for details that generally relate to the management of earth science specimens and their individual stratigraphic age (which may be different or more specific than that recorderd for the gathering site or the host rock.

label: CrystalMeasurement Accuracy
definition: Statement of accuracy of measurement.

label: AnalysisDateTime TimeOfDayBegin
definition: Time of day in hours from midnight for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period.

label: DrillMethod
definition: How the borehole or well was drilled e.g. reverse circulation drilling, diamond coring, percussion drilling, auger drilling, rotary/barber drilling etc.

label: BottomSurface
definition: Container for details of bottom surface of layer or stratum.

label: Geologists SortingName
definition: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

label: Geologists Suffix
definition: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

label: Contractor
definition: The drilling contractor who carried out the work.

label: BottomSurfaceFeature
definition: Text describing features at the base of a layer or stratum.

label: DatingQualifier
definition: Allows for qualification of date terms e.g. early/lower, middle, late/upper.

label: Geologists Organisation
definition: Organisation type from the abcd schema.

label: CrystalMeasurement MeasurementOrFactText
definition: Free text alternative to atomised version.

label: AnalysisReferences AnalysisReference
definition: Individual documentary reference linked to an analysis. Uses abcd:Reference Type

label: HostRockStratigraphy BiostratigraphicAttribution AppliesTo
definition: Depending on the use of the type, this can further specify the actual part measured. For example, a measurement of temperature may be a surface, air or sub-surface measurement.

label: DiageneticChange
definition: Free text for describing any physical and chemical changes that took place in a sediment during the lithification process e.g. compaction, cementation, recrystallisation, dolomitisation and replacement.

label: HostRockStratigraphy BiostratigraphicAttribution
definition: A single declaration of a fossil zone or subzone.

label: CrystalMeasurement CitationDetail
definition: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

label: AssemblageOrigin
definition: Free text description relating to the mode of origin of the assemblage e.g. unknown, allochthonous, autochthonous, paraautochthonous etc.

label: AlterationType
definition: Free text describing the type of change that has taken place e.g. chloritisation, migmatisation, cataclastic brecciation etc.

label: CrystalMeasurements
definition: Container for measurements of crystal physical and chemical characteristics.

label: Geologists Text
definition: Label text in a specific language.

label: AnalysisDateTime TimeOfDayEnd
definition: Time of day in hours from midnight for the end of a time period.

label: AnalysisDateTime ExactDate DateText
definition: The date in text format.

label: AnalysisDateTime DayNumberEnd
definition: The Julian day number of the last day in a period.

label: AllocthonousMaterial
definition: Container for descriptive elements related to transported material ranging from glacial erratics to meteorites

label: CrystalMeasurement LowerValue
definition: Lower or only value or fact text.

label: CommissionedBy
definition: Company or organisation who commissioned the borehole or well.

label: Certainty
definition: Degree of certainty associated with the date determination e.g. unknown, certain, uncertain, possibly, known wrong.

label: Geologists Person
definition: Person type from the abcd schema.

label: AlterationDegree
definition: Free text describing the degree of alteration or metamorphic phase that has affected a rock. [This element may need to be split into hydrothermal mineralogical change and metamorphic phases]

label: CrystalMeasurement MeasurementOrFactReference
definition: Reference (publication) where this measurement was taken from.

label: CrystalMeasurement UpperValue
definition: Upper value where there is a range.

label: Bioerosion
definition: Free text description of damage due to biological action, such as, boring worms and sponges.

label: AnalysisDateTime DayNumberBegin
definition: Julian day number in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period

label: CrystalMeasurement MeasurementDateTime
definition: Date and/or Time the measurement was taken.

label: CrystalMeasurement UnitOfMeasurement
definition: Unit of measurement.

label: DistanceFromBaseline
definition: Number representing distance measured.

label: CrystalMeasurement URI
definition: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

label: AnalysisDateTime ISODateTimeEnd
definition: The end of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format.

label: HostRockStratigraphy BiostratigraphicAttribution Abbreviation
definition: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

label: AnalysisDateTime ExactDate
definition: Uses DateTime element from ABCD.

label: Geologists Prefix
definition: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

label: Geologists InheritedName
definition: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard.  (vCard:N.Family)

label: Geologists FullName
definition: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

label: Borehole
definition: Container for details specific to boreholes and wells. Does not contain spatial reference as this and details of platform etc. are under Gathering in main ABCD schema - but they could be copied to make an independent schema.

label: Geologists OrgUnits
definition: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

label: CrystalMeasurement MeasuredBy
definition: Attribution of the measurement to a Person

label: CrystalMeasurement IsQuantitative
definition: Flag indicating if the value represents the numerical result of a quantitative measurement (TRUE) or a descriptor with textual or categorical result (FALSE).

label: HostRockStratigraphy BiostratigraphicAttribution Accuracy
definition: Statement of accuracy of measurement.

label: AnalysisDateTime PeriodExplicit
definition: Set to True if the event takes place for the period indicated, set to False if it occurs at some point of time during the period, not filled if unknown or no period specified.

label: AnalysisReferences URI
definition: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

label: Encrustation
definition: Free text description of biological encrustations, such as oysters and tube worms.

label: HoleDiameter
definition: Diameter of the borehole in milliimetres.

label: Geologists GivenNames
definition: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

label: Articulation
definition: Free text description of the articulation in the preserved specimen - applies to invertebrate shells and exoskeletons as well as vertebrate skeletons. e.g. articulated, dis-articulated, single valves etc.
